Israeli army approaches Gaza City: 'We are not waiting'
description: With Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu yet to make a decision on a temporary ceasefire proposal, maneuvers are underway around the Gaza Strip's largest city, which the army calls a Hamas 'stronghold.' More than 120,000 reservists are expected to be deployed on the ground in the coming weeks.

Merz sparks outcry over possible German military involvement to defend Ukraine
description: Even if the deployment of German troops remains hypothetical, the mere mention of it was enough to polarize a country deeply rooted in pacifist culture. For the Social Democrats, coalition partners of the conservative chancellor, any involvement of the Bundeswehr would be inconceivable without American participation.

headline: Why scientists are divided over whether there is a 'sixth mass extinction'
description: American researchers have reignited the debate over the concept by publishing an article that questions the idea of a new mass extinction event that is comparable in scale to the one that wiped out the dinosaurs.

headline: La Piscine in Roubaix invites visitors to take a plunge into culture
description: 'Strange places for an exhibition' (3/6). Le Monde explores six art centers housed in unique locations. Today: an Art Deco building transformed in 2001 into La Piscine Museum of Art and Industry in northern France.

headline: On the 'art of shunning' – and the risks that come with it
description: 'Letters from America' (4/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams considers the dangers of cancel culture and 'wokeness.' It is better to engage in dialogue, even if it is difficult, in the real world than to 'punish and ostracize' on social media, he says.

France faces prospect of paying higher borrowing costs than Italy
description: Rome has significantly reduced its public deficit over the past three years, while Paris has allowed its own to spiral. In the eyes of investors, Italy is now as credible as France, despite a heavier debt burden. On the markets, the gap in interest rates between the two countries has nearly vanished.

headline: What is Kick, the platform on which a French streamer died live?
description: Raphaël Grave, known online as Jean Pormanove, died Monday during a livestream. The tragedy has shed light on a little-known streaming site and its extremely permissive moderation policies.

headline: Why heat and drought are making trees look like autumn is coming early
description: In some regions, drought combined with extreme heat has led to defoliation, a phenomenon that, if recurring, can cause forest dieback.
